abstract: Johnson & Johnson has agreed to buy the medical equipment maker Synthes for $21.3 billion in cash and stock, in one of the biggest deals ever in the health care sector.
snippet: Johnson & Johnson has agreed to buy the medical equipment maker Synthes for $21.3 billion in cash and stock, in one of the biggest deals ever in the health care sector.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson said on Wednesday that it had agreed to buy the medical equipment maker Synthes for $21.3 billion in cash and stock, in one of the biggest deals ever in the health care sector.

headline.main: J.&J. to Buy Synthes for $21.3 Billion

abstract: Johnson & Johnson is paying for the deal in stock and cash, rather than incurring a tax penalty for repatriating money from abroad.
snippet: Johnson & Johnson is paying for the deal in stock and cash, rather than incurring a tax penalty for repatriating money from abroad.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson’s bid for Synthes, a Swiss-American medical equipment manufacturer, makes a lot of strategic sense.

headline.main: Why Johnson & Johnson Is Using Stock to Buy Synthes

abstract: CNBC talks with Johnson & Johnson’s chief executive, William C. Weldon, about the strategy behind the bid to buy Synthes.
snippet: CNBC talks with Johnson & Johnson’s chief executive, William C. Weldon, about the strategy behind the bid to buy Synthes.
lead_paragraph: CNBC talks with Johnson & Johnson’s chief executive, William C. Weldon, about the strategy behind the bid to buy Synthes.

abstract: The structure of Johnson & Johnson’s deal with Synthes suggests that it has other deals in mind.
snippet: The structure of Johnson & Johnson’s deal with Synthes suggests that it has other deals in mind.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson may have more on its overseas shopping list. The health giant’s $21.3 billion purchase of the Swiss-listed Synthes is its largest ever. A big deal seemed like a way for J.& J. to deploy its $28 billion of cash, largely trapped overseas. But as it turns out, it is paying mostly in stock.

headline.main: J.&J. May Have More Acquisitions in Mind
headline.print_headline: J.&J. May Have A Shopping List

byline.original: By ROBERT CYRAN and ANTONY CURRIE
